properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: label
properties.description: • label - (Required) A short description of the Image. Labels cannot contain special characters.

properties.name: disk_id
properties.description: • disk_id - (Required) The ID of the Linode Disk that this Image will be created from.

properties.name: linode_id
properties.description: • linode_id - (Required) The ID of the Linode that this Image will be created from.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A detailed description of this Image.

properties.name: timeouts
properties.description: » Timeouts
The timeouts block allows you to specify timeouts for certain actions:

properties.name: create
properties.description: (Defaults to 20 mins) Used when creating the instance image (until the instance is available)

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This resource exports the following attributes:

properties.name: id
properties.description: • id - The unique ID of this Image. The ID of private images begin with private/ followed by the numeric identifier of the private image, for example private/12345.

properties.name: created
properties.description: • created - When this Image was created.

properties.name: created_by
properties.description: • created_by - The name of the User who created this Image.

properties.name: deprecated
properties.description: • deprecated - Whether or not this Image is deprecated. Will only be True for deprecated public Images.

properties.name: is_public
properties.description: • is_public - True if the Image is public.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - The minimum size this Image needs to deploy. Size is in MB.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - How the Image was created. 'Manual' Images can be created at any time. 'Automatic' images are created automatically from a deleted Linode.

properties.name: expiry
properties.description: • expiry - Only Images created automatically (from a deleted Linode; type=automatic) will expire.

properties.name: vendor
properties.description: • vendor - The upstream distribution vendor. Nil for private Images.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Required) This is the location where the Linode is deployed. Examples are "us-east", "us-west", "ap-south", etc. Changing region forces the creation of a new Linode Instance..

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The Linode type defines the pricing, CPU, disk, and RAM specs of the instance. Examples are "g6-nanode-1", "g6-standard-2", "g6-highmem-16", "g6-dedicated-16", etc.

properties.name: label
properties.description: • label - (Optional) The Linode's label is for display purposes only. If no label is provided for a Linode, a default will be assigned.

properties.name: group
properties.description: • group - (Optional) The display group of the Linode instance.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

properties.name: private_ip
properties.description: • private_ip - (Optional) If true, the created Linode will have private networking enabled, allowing use of the 192.168.128.0/17 network within the Linode's region. It can be enabled on an existing Linode but it can't be disabled.

properties.name: alerts.0.cpu
properties.description: • alerts.0.cpu - (Optional) The percentage of CPU usage required to trigger an alert. If the average CPU usage over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0, the alert is disabled.

properties.name: alerts.0.network_in
properties.description: • alerts.0.network_in - (Optional) The amount of incoming traffic, in Mbit/s, required to trigger an alert. If the average incoming traffic over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

properties.name: alerts.0.network_out
properties.description: • alerts.0.network_out - (Optional) The amount of outbound traffic, in Mbit/s, required to trigger an alert. If the average outbound traffic over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

properties.name: alerts.0.transfer_quota
properties.description: • alerts.0.transfer_quota - (Optional) The percentage of network transfer that may be used before an alert is triggered. When this value is exceeded, we'll alert you. If this is set to 0 (zero), the alert is disabled.

properties.name: alerts.0.io
properties.description: • alerts.0.io - (Optional) The amount of disk IO operation per second required to trigger an alert. If the average disk IO over two hours exceeds this value, we'll send you an alert. If set to 0, this alert is disabled.

properties.name: backups_enabled
properties.description: • backups_enabled - (Optional) If this field is set to true, the created Linode will automatically be enrolled in the Linode Backup service. This will incur an additional charge. The cost for the Backup service is dependent on the Type of Linode deployed.

properties.name: watchdog_enabled
properties.description: • watchdog_enabled - (Optional) The watchdog, named Lassie, is a Shutdown Watchdog that monitors your Linode and will reboot it if it powers off unexpectedly. It works by issuing a boot job when your Linode powers off without a shutdown job being responsible. To prevent a loop, Lassie will give up if there have been more than 5 boot jobs issued within 15 minutes.

properties.name: simplified-resource-arguments
properties.description: » Simplified Resource Arguments

Just as the Linode API provides, these fields are for the most common provisioning use case, a single data disk, a single swap disk, and a single config. These arguments are not compatible with disk and config fields, described later.

properties.name: authorized_keys
properties.description: • authorized_keys - (Optional with image) A list of SSH public keys to deploy for the root user on the newly created Linode. This value can not be imported. Changing authorized_keys forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: authorized_users
properties.description: • authorized_users - (Optional with image) A list of Linode usernames. If the usernames have associated SSH keys, the keys will be appended to the root user's ~/.ssh/authorized_keys file automatically. This value can not be imported. Changing authorized_users forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: root_pass
properties.description: • root_pass - (Optional) The initial password for the root user account. This value can not be imported. Changing root_pass forces the creation of a new Linode Instance. If omitted, a random password will be generated but will not be stored in Terraform state.

properties.name: image
properties.description: • image - (Optional) An Image ID to deploy the Disk from. Official Linode Images start with linode/, while your Images start with private/. See images for more information on the Images available for you to use. Examples are linode/debian9, linode/fedora28, linode/ubuntu16.04lts, linode/arch, and private/12345. This value can not be imported. Changing image forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: stackscript_id
properties.description: • stackscript_id - (Optional) The StackScript to deploy to the newly created Linode. If provided, 'image' must also be provided, and must be an Image that is compatible with this StackScript. This value can not be imported. Changing stackscript_id forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: stackscript_data
properties.description: • stackscript_data - (Optional) An object containing responses to any User Defined Fields present in the StackScript being deployed to this Linode. Only accepted if 'stackscript_id' is given. The required values depend on the StackScript being deployed. This value can not be imported. Changing stackscript_data forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: swap_size
properties.description: • swap_size - (Optional) When deploying from an Image, this field is optional with a Linode API default of 512mb, otherwise it is ignored. This is used to set the swap disk size for the newly-created Linode.

properties.name: backup_id
properties.description: • backup_id - (Optional) A Backup ID from another Linode's available backups. Your User must have read_write access to that Linode, the Backup must have a status of successful, and the Linode must be deployed to the same region as the Backup. See /linode/instances/{linodeId}/backups for a Linode's available backups. This field and the image field are mutually exclusive. This value can not be imported. Changing backup_id forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: disk-and-config-arguments
properties.description: » Disk and Config Arguments

By specifying the disk and config fields for a Linode instance, it is possible to use non-standard kernels, boot with and provision multiple disks, and modify the boot behaviors (helpers) of the Linode.

properties.name: boot_config_label
properties.description: (Optional) The Label of the Instance Config that should be used to boot the Linode instance. If there is only one config, the label of that config will be used as the boot_config_label. This value can not be imported.

properties.name: disks
properties.description: » Disks

properties.name: list description
properties.description: disk

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Required) The disks label, which acts as an identifier in Terraform. This must be unique within each Linode Instance.

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required) The size of the Disk in MB.

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Computed) The ID of the disk in the Linode API.

properties.name: filesystem
properties.description: (Optional) The Disk filesystem can be one of: "raw", "swap", "ext3", "ext4", or "initrd" which has a max size of 32mb and can be used in the config initrd (not currently supported in this Terraform Provider).

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: (Optional) If true, this Disk is read-only.

properties.name: image
properties.description: (Optional) An Image ID to deploy the Disk from. Official Linode Images start with linode/, while your Images start with private/. See /images for more information on the Images available for you to use. Examples are linode/debian9, linode/fedora28, linode/ubuntu16.04lts, linode/arch, and private/12345. Changing image forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: authorized_keys
properties.description: (Optional with image) A list of SSH public keys to deploy for the root user on the newly created Linode. Only accepted if image is provided. This value can not be imported. Changing authorized_keys forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: authorized_users
properties.description: (Optional with image) A list of Linode usernames. If the usernames have associated SSH keys, the keys will be appended to the root user's ~/.ssh/authorized_keys file automatically. This value can not be imported. Changing authorized_users forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: root_pass
properties.description: (Optional with image) The initial password for the root user account. This value can not be imported. Changing root_pass forces the creation of a new Linode Instance. If omitted, a random password will be generated but will not be stored in Terraform state.

properties.name: stackscript_id
properties.description: (Optional with image) The StackScript to deploy to the newly created Linode. If provided, 'image' must also be provided, and must be an Image that is compatible with this StackScript. This value can not be imported. Changing stackscript_id forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: stackscript_data
properties.description: (Optional with image) An object containing responses to any User Defined Fields present in the StackScript being deployed to this Linode. Only accepted if 'stackscript_id' is given. The required values depend on the StackScript being deployed. This value can not be imported. Changing stackscript_data forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.

properties.name: configs
properties.description: » Configs
Configuration profiles define the VM settings and boot behavior of the Linode Instance. Multiple configurations profiles can be provided but their label values must be unique.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: config

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Required) The Config's label for display purposes. Also used by boot_config_label.

properties.name: helpers
properties.description: (Options) Helpers enabled when booting to this Linode Config.

properties.name: updatedb_disabled
properties.description: (Optional) Disables updatedb cron job to avoid disk thrashing.

properties.name: distro
properties.description: (Optional) Controls the behavior of the Linode Config's Distribution Helper setting.

properties.name: modules_dep
properties.description: (Optional) Creates a modules dependency file for the Kernel you run.

properties.name: network
properties.description: (Optional) Controls the behavior of the Linode Config's Network Helper setting, used to automatically configure additional IP addresses assigned to this instance.

properties.name: devices
properties.description: (Optional) A list of disk or volume attachments for this config. If the boot_config_label omits a devices block, the Linode will not be booted.

properties.name: sda
properties.description:
... sdh - (Optional) The SDA-SDH slots, represent the Linux block device nodes for the first 8 disks attached to the Linode. Each device must be suplied sequentially. The device can be either a Disk or a Volume identified by disk_label or volume_id. Only one disk identifier is permitted per slot. Devices mapped from sde through sdh are unavailable in "fullvirt" virt_mode.
  • disk_label - (Optional) The label of the disk to map to this device slot.
  • volume_id - (Optional) The Volume ID to map to this device slot.
  • disk_id - (Computed) The Disk ID of the associated disk_label, if used.

properties.name: disk_label
properties.description: (Optional) The label of the disk to map to this device slot.

properties.name: volume_id
properties.description: (Optional) The Volume ID to map to this device slot.

properties.name: disk_id
properties.description: (Computed) The Disk ID of the associated disk_label, if used.

properties.name: kernel
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: run_level
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: virt_mode
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: root_device
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: comments
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: memory_limit
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: disk_label
properties.description: (Optional) The label of the disk to map to this device slot.

properties.name: volume_id
properties.description: (Optional) The Volume ID to map to this device slot.

properties.name: disk_id
properties.description: (Computed) The Disk ID of the associated disk_label, if used.

properties.name: timeouts
properties.description: » Timeouts
The timeouts block allows you to specify timeouts for certain actions:

properties.name: create
properties.description: (Defaults to 10 mins) Used when launching the instance (until it reaches the initial running state)

properties.name: update
properties.description: (Defaults to 20 mins) Used when stopping and starting the instance when necessary during update

properties.name: delete
properties.description: (Defaults to 10 mins) Used when terminating the instance

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This Linode Instance resource exports the following attributes:

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - The status of the instance, indicating the current readiness state. (running, offline, ...)

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - A string containing the Linode's public IP address.

properties.name: private_ip_address
properties.description: • private_ip_address - This Linode's Private IPv4 Address, if enabled. The regional private IP address range, 192.168.128.0/17, is shared by all Linode Instances in a region.

properties.name: ipv6
properties.description: • ipv6 - This Linode's IPv6 SLAAC addresses. This address is specific to a Linode, and may not be shared. The prefix (/64) is included in this attribute.

properties.name: ipv4
properties.description: • ipv4 - This Linode's IPv4 Addresses. Each Linode is assigned a single public IPv4 address upon creation, and may get a single private IPv4 address if needed. You may need to open a support ticket to get additional IPv4 addresses.

properties.name: specs.0.disk
properties.description: • specs.0.disk - The amount of storage space, in GB. this Linode has access to. A typical Linode will divide this space between a primary disk with an image deployed to it, and a swap disk, usually 512 MB. This is the default configuration created when deploying a Linode with an image through POST /linode/instances.

properties.name: specs.0.memory
properties.description: • specs.0.memory - The amount of RAM, in MB, this Linode has access to. Typically a Linode will choose to boot with all of its available RAM, but this can be configured in a Config profile.

properties.name: specs.0.vcpus
properties.description: • specs.0.vcpus - The number of vcpus this Linode has access to. Typically a Linode will choose to boot with all of its available vcpus, but this can be configured in a Config Profile.

properties.name: specs.0.transfer
properties.description: • specs.0.transfer - The amount of network transfer this Linode is allotted each month.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: backups - Information about this Linode's backups status.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: If this Linode has the Backup service enabled.

properties.name: schedule
day
properties.description: The day of the week that your Linode's weekly Backup is taken. If not set manually, a day will be chosen for you. Backups are taken every day, but backups taken on this day are preferred when selecting backups to retain for a longer period.  If not set manually, then when backups are initially enabled, this may come back as "Scheduling" until the day is automatically selected.

properties.name: window
properties.description: The window ('W0'-'W22') in which your backups will be taken, in UTC. A backups window is a two-hour span of time in which the backup may occur. For example, 'W10' indicates that your backups should be taken between 10:00 and 12:00. If you do not choose a backup window, one will be selected for you automatically.  If not set manually, when backups are initially enabled this may come back as Scheduling until the window is automatically selected.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: domain
properties.description: • domain - (Required) The domain this Domain represents. These must be unique in our system; you cannot have two Domains representing the same domain.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) If this Domain represents the authoritative source of information for the domain it describes, or if it is a read-only copy of a master (also called a slave).

properties.name: soa_email
properties.description: • soa_email - (Required) Start of Authority email address. This is required for master Domains.

properties.name: master_ips
properties.description: • master_ips - (Required for type="slave") The IP addresses representing the master DNS for this Domain.
<hr/>

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - (Optional) Used to control whether this Domain is currently being rendered (defaults to "active").

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for this Domain. This is for display purposes only.

properties.name: group
properties.description: • group - (Optional) The group this Domain belongs to. This is for display purposes only.

properties.name: ttl_sec
properties.description: • ttl_sec - (Optional) 'Time to Live' - the amount of time in seconds that this Domain's records may be cached by resolvers or other domain servers. Valid values are 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

properties.name: retry_sec
properties.description: • retry_sec - (Optional) The interval, in seconds, at which a failed refresh should be retried. Valid values are 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

properties.name: expire_sec
properties.description: • expire_sec - (Optional) The amount of time in seconds that may pass before this Domain is no longer authoritative. Valid values are 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

properties.name: refresh_sec
properties.description: • refresh_sec - (Optional) The amount of time in seconds before this Domain should be refreshed. Valid values are 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

properties.name: axfr_ips
properties.description: • axfr_ips - (Optional) The list of IPs that may perform a zone transfer for this Domain. This is potentially dangerous, and should be set to an empty list unless you intend to use it.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This resource exports no additional attributes, however status may reflect degraded states.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of this Record. This field's actual usage depends on the type of record this represents. For A and AAAA records, this is the subdomain being associated with an IP address.

properties.name: domain_id
properties.description: • domain_id - (Required) The ID of the Domain to access. Changing domain_id forces the creation of a new Linode Domain Record..

properties.name: record_type
properties.description: • record_type - (Required) The type of Record this is in the DNS system. For example, A records associate a domain name with an IPv4 address, and AAAA records associate a domain name with an IPv6 address. Changing record_type forces the creation of a new Linode Domain Record..

properties.name: target
properties.description: • target - (Required) The target for this Record. This field's actual usage depends on the type of record this represents. For A and AAAA records, this is the address the named Domain should resolve to.

properties.name: ttl_sec
properties.description: • ttl_sec - (Optional) 'Time to Live' - the amount of time in seconds that this Domain's records may be cached by resolvers or other domain servers. Valid values are 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Optional) The priority of the target host. Lower values are preferred.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Optional) The protocol this Record's service communicates with. Only valid for SRV records.

properties.name: service
properties.description: • service - (Optional) The service this Record identified. Only valid for SRV records.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: • tag - (Optional) The tag portion of a CAA record. It is invalid to set this on other record types.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional) The port this Record points to.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: • weight - (Optional) The relative weight of this Record. Higher values are preferred.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This resource exports no additional attributes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) The region where this NodeBalancer will be deployed. Examples are "us-east", "us-west", "ap-south", etc. Changing region forces the creation of a new Linode NodeBalancer..
<hr/>

properties.name: label
properties.description: • label - (Optional) The label of the Linode NodeBalancer

properties.name: client_conn_throttle
properties.description: • client_conn_throttle - (Optional) Throttle connections per second (0-20). Set to 0 (default) to disable throttling.

properties.name: linode_id
properties.description: • linode_id - (Optional) The ID of a Linode Instance where the the NodeBalancer should be attached.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This resource exports the following attributes:

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: • hostname - This NodeBalancer's hostname, ending with .nodebalancer.linode.com

properties.name: ipv4
properties.description: • ipv4 - The Public IPv4 Address of this NodeBalancer

properties.name: ipv6
properties.description: • ipv6 - The Public IPv6 Address of this NodeBalancer
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: nodebalancer_id
properties.description: • nodebalancer_id - (Required) The ID of the NodeBalancer to access.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Required) The region where this nodebalancer_config will be deployed. Examples are "us-east", "us-west", "ap-south", etc. Changing region forces the creation of a new Linode NodeBalancer Config..
<hr/>

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Optional) The protocol this port is configured to serve. If this is set to https you must include an ssl_cert and an ssl_key. (Defaults to "http")

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional) The TCP port this Config is for. These values must be unique across configs on a single NodeBalancer (you can't have two configs for port 80, for example). While some ports imply some protocols, no enforcement is done and you may configure your NodeBalancer however is useful to you. For example, while port 443 is generally used for HTTPS, you do not need SSL configured to have a NodeBalancer listening on port 443. (Defaults to 80)

properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: • algorithm - (Optional) What algorithm this NodeBalancer should use for routing traffic to backends: roundrobin, leastconn, source

properties.name: stickiness
properties.description: • stickiness - (Optional) Controls how session stickiness is handled on this port: 'none', 'table', 'http_cookie'

properties.name: check
properties.description: • check - (Optional) The type of check to perform against backends to ensure they are serving requests. This is used to determine if backends are up or down. If none no check is performed. connection requires only a connection to the backend to succeed. http and http_body rely on the backend serving HTTP, and that the response returned matches what is expected.

properties.name: check_interval
properties.description: • check_interval - (Optional) How often, in seconds, to check that backends are up and serving requests.

properties.name: check_timeout
properties.description: • check_timeout - (Optional) How long, in seconds, to wait for a check attempt before considering it failed. (1-30)

properties.name: check_attempts
properties.description: • check_attempts - (Optional) How many times to attempt a check before considering a backend to be down. (1-30)

properties.name: check_path
properties.description: • check_path - (Optional) The URL path to check on each backend. If the backend does not respond to this request it is considered to be down.

properties.name: check_passive
properties.description: • check_passive - (Optional) If true, any response from this backend with a 5xx status code will be enough for it to be considered unhealthy and taken out of rotation.

properties.name: cipher_suite
properties.description: • cipher_suite - (Optional) What ciphers to use for SSL connections served by this NodeBalancer. legacy is considered insecure and should only be used if necessary.

properties.name: ssl_cert
properties.description: • ssl_cert - (Optional) The certificate this port is serving. This is not returned. If set, this field will come back as <REDACTED>. Please use the ssl_commonname and ssl_fingerprint to identify the certificate.

properties.name: ssl_key
properties.description: • ssl_key - (Optional) The private key corresponding to this port's certificate. This is not returned. If set, this field will come back as <REDACTED>. Please use the ssl_commonname and ssl_fingerprint to identify the certificate.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This resource exports the following attributes:

properties.name: ssl_commonname
properties.description: • ssl_commonname - The common name for the SSL certification this port is serving if this port is not configured to use SSL.

properties.name: ssl_fingerprint
properties.description: • ssl_fingerprint - The fingerprint for the SSL certification this port is serving if this port is not configured to use SSL.

properties.name: node_status_up
properties.description: • node_status_up - The number of backends considered to be 'UP' and healthy, and that are serving requests.

properties.name: node_status_down
properties.description: • node_status_down - The number of backends considered to be 'DOWN' and unhealthy. These are not in rotation, and not serving requests.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: label
properties.description: • label - (Required) The label of the Linode NodeBalancer Node. This is for display purposes only.

properties.name: nodebalancer_id
properties.description: • nodebalancer_id - (Required) The ID of the NodeBalancer to access.

properties.name: config_id
properties.description: • config_id - (Required) The ID of the NodeBalancerConfig to access.

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Required) The private IP Address where this backend can be reached. This must be a private IP address.
<hr/>

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Optional) The mode this NodeBalancer should use when sending traffic to this backend. If set to accept this backend is accepting traffic. If set to reject this backend will not receive traffic. If set to drain this backend will not receive new traffic, but connections already pinned to it will continue to be routed to it

properties.name: weight
properties.description: • weight - (Optional) Used when picking a backend to serve a request and is not pinned to a single backend yet. Nodes with a higher weight will receive more traffic. (1-255).

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This resource exports the following attributes:

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - The current status of this node, based on the configured checks of its NodeBalancer Config. (unknown, UP, DOWN).

properties.name: config_id
properties.description: • config_id - The ID of the NodeBalancerConfig this NodeBalancerNode is attached to.

properties.name: nodebalancer_id
properties.description: • nodebalancer_id - The ID of the NodeBalancer this NodeBalancerNode is attached to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - The Public IPv4 or IPv6 address that will receive the PTR record. A matching A or AAAA record must exist.

properties.name: rdns
properties.description: • rdns - The name of the RDNS address.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: label
properties.description: • label - A label for the SSH Key.

properties.name: ssh_key
properties.description: • ssh_key - The public SSH Key, which is used to authenticate to the root user of the Linodes you deploy.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This resource exports the following attributes:

properties.name: created
properties.description: The date this SSH Key was created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: label
properties.description: • label - (Required) The StackScript's label is for display purposes only.

properties.name: script
properties.description: • script - (Required) The script to execute when provisioning a new Linode with this StackScript.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description for the StackScript.
<hr/>

properties.name: rev_note
properties.description: • rev_note - (Optional) This field allows you to add notes for the set of revisions made to this StackScript.

properties.name: is_public
properties.description: • is_public - (Optional) This determines whether other users can use your StackScript. Once a StackScript is made public, it cannot be made private. Changing is_public forces the creation of a new StackScript

properties.name: images
properties.description: • images - (Optional) An array of Image IDs representing the Images that this StackScript is compatible for deploying with.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This resource exports the following attributes:

properties.name: deployments_active
properties.description: • deployments_active - Count of currently active, deployed Linodes created from this StackScript.

properties.name: user_gravatar_id
properties.description: • user_gravatar_id - The Gravatar ID for the User who created the StackScript.

properties.name: deployments_total
properties.description: • deployments_total - The total number of times this StackScript has been deployed.

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - The User who created the StackScript.

properties.name: created
properties.description: • created - The date this StackScript was created.

properties.name: updated
properties.description: • updated - The date this StackScript was updated.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: user_defined_fields - This is a list of fields defined with a special syntax inside this StackScript that allow for supplying customized parameters during deployment.

properties.name: label
properties.description: A human-readable label for the field that will serve as the input prompt for entering the value during deployment.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the field.

properties.name: example
properties.description: An example value for the field.

properties.name: one_of
properties.description: A list of acceptable single values for the field.

properties.name: many_of
properties.description: A list of acceptable values for the field in any quantity, combination or order.

properties.name: default
properties.description: The default value. If not specified, this value will be used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: label
properties.description: • label - A label for the Token.

properties.name: scopes
properties.description: • scopes - The scopes this token was created with. These define what parts of the Account the token can be used to access. Many command-line tools, such as the Linode CLI, require tokens with access to *. Tokens with more restrictive scopes are generally more secure.

properties.name: expiry
properties.description: • expiry - When this token will expire. Personal Access Tokens cannot be renewed, so after this time the token will be completely unusable and a new token will need to be generated. Tokens may be created with 'null' as their expiry and will never expire unless revoked.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This resource exports the following attributes:

properties.name: token
properties.description: • token - The token used to access the API.

properties.name: created
properties.description: • created - The date this Token was created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: label
properties.description: • label - (Required) The label of the Linode Volume

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Required) The region where this volume will be deployed. Examples are "us-east", "us-west", "ap-south", etc. Changing region forces the creation of a new Linode Volume..
<hr/>

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Optional) Size of the Volume in GB.

properties.name: linode_id
properties.description: • linode_id - (Optional) The ID of a Linode Instance where the the Volume should be attached.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

properties.name: timeouts
properties.description: » Timeouts
The timeouts block allows you to specify timeouts for certain actions:

properties.name: create
properties.description: (Defaults to 10 mins) Used when creating the volume (until the volume is reaches the initial active state)

properties.name: update
properties.description: (Defaults to 20 mins) Used when updating the volume when necessary during update

properties.name: delete
properties.description: (Defaults to 10 mins) Used when deleting the volume

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
This resource exports the following attributes:

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - The label of the Linode Volume.

properties.name: filesystem_path
properties.description: • filesystem_path - The full filesystem path for the Volume based on the Volume's label. The path is "/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-0Linode_Volume_" + the Volume label
